text: the dramatic rescue of a woman trapped
in the rubble of a collapsed garment
factory in Bangladesh is one of the
first pieces of good news in a story
that has been unrelentingly grim fire
incident so we did not use any
electrical equipment only she seems to
be fine
the immediate medical treatment was
required I am so happy that she is back
this means a lot for my son and
grandchildren they are overwhelmed the
woman who has only been identified so
far as Reshma was a garment worker she
was trapped in the basement but not
crushed when the building collapsed
according to rescuers she had enough
clear space to stand and reach some food
and water when I was cutting down some
rods
I saw someone trying to move an aluminum
rod when I listened closely I heard a
female voice asking for me to stay I
immediately told the army and Fire
Brigade to look for survivors because I
had heard a voice and seen some movement
while Reshma has survived the death toll
in the collapse has passed 1000 people
and is expected to rise more it's
already the worst disaster in the
history of the garment industry and has
intensified pressure on retailers who
buy clothing manufactured in Bangladesh
you
